MacSyLib

  • system

systemÔÉÅ

This module classes and functions which a given set of hits and a model compute if this set satisfy the model or not

The object which check the compliance of hits to a model is MatchMaker which have 2 sub-classes for ordered and unordered replicons

MatchMaker.match method link hit to a model (macsylib.hit.ValidHit) and then check if these valid hit satisfy the quorum constraints defined in the model. According this it instanciate a macsylib.system.System or macsylib.system.RejectedCandidate for ordered replicons or macsylib.system.LikelySystem or macsylib.system.UnlikelySystem for unordered replicons

below the inheritance diagram:

Warning

The abstract class macsylib.system.AbstractSetOfHits is controlled by the metaclass macsylib.system.MetaSetOfHits which inject on the fly several private attributes and public properties (see more in macsylib.system.MetaSetOfHits documentation)

class macsylib.system.OrderedMatchMaker(model: Model, redundancy_penalty: float)[source]ÔÉÅ

check if a set of hits match the quorum for ordered replicons (ordered_replicon or gembase)

__init__(model: Model, redundancy_penalty: float) → None[source]ÔÉÅ
Parameters:

  • model ‚Äì The model used compute genetic constraints

  • redundancy_penalty ‚Äì The penalty applied to compute the score when several genes coding for same function are present in same cluster.

match(clusters: Iterable[Cluster]) → System | RejectedCandidate[source]ÔÉÅ

Check a set of clusters fill model constraints. If yes create a macsylib.system.System otherwise create a macsylib.cluster.RejectedCandidate.

Parameters:

clusters ‚Äì The list of cluster to check if fit the model

Returns:

either a System or a RejectedCandidates

MetaSetOfHitsÔÉÅ

class macsylib.system.MetaSetOfHits(name, bases, namespace, /, **kwargs)[source]ÔÉÅ

This metaclass control the AbstractSetOfHits class creation. In this metaclass we inject on the fly several attributes and properties two private attributes and one public property corresponding to each value of _supported_status class attribute defined in the concrete classes. for instance for System class

  • the attributes

    • self._mandatory

    • self._mandatory_occ

    • self._accessory

    • self._accessory_occ

    • self._neutral

    • self._neutral_occ

  • and the properties

    • mandatory

    • accessory

    • neutral

are automatically injected

The value for attributes _<status>_occ are filled by the count method which is defined in AbstractSetOfHits

__call__(*args, **kwargs)[source]ÔÉÅ

Call self as a function.

getter_maker() → Callable[source]ÔÉÅ

Create a property which allow to access to the gene corresponding of the cat of the model

Parameters:

status ‚Äì the type of gene category to which we create the getter

Returns:

unbound method

property position: tuple[int, int]ÔÉÅ
Returns:

The position of the first and last hit (start: int, end:int), excluded the hit coding for loners. If the system is composed only by loners, used loners to compute position

property replicon_name: strÔÉÅ
Returns:

The name of the replicon

Return type:

str

property wholeness: floatÔÉÅ
Returns:

a score indicating the genes ratio of the model which have at least one hit by default full system is mandatory + accessory (‚Äòneutral‚Äô genes do not count) but for special corner case it can be specified in model definition (xml) or on the command line

SystemÔÉÅ

class macsylib.system.System(*args, **kwargs)[source]ÔÉÅ

Modeling as system. a system is an occurrence of a given model on a replicon.

__init__(model: Model, clusters: list[Cluster], redundancy_penalty: float = 1.5) → None[source]ÔÉÅ
Parameters:

  • model (macsylib.model.Model object) ‚Äì The model which has been used to build this system

  • clusters (list of macsylib.cluster.Cluster objects) ‚Äì The list of cluster that form this system

__str__() → str[source]ÔÉÅ

Return str(self).

get_hits_encoding_multisystem() → set[MultiSystem][source]ÔÉÅ
Returns:

The hits codding for a gene taged as multi system

get_loners() → set[Loner | LonerMultiSystem][source]ÔÉÅ
Returns:

The True Loners (Loner which not colocalize with another hit) belonging to the systems

get_multisystems() → set[MultiSystem | LonerMultiSystem][source]ÔÉÅ
Returns:

The MultiSystem hit (comming from out system (other cluster or loner) and tag as multisystem)

property hits: list[ModelHit]ÔÉÅ
Returns:

The list of all hits that compose this system

is_compatible(other: System) → bool[source]ÔÉÅ
Parameters:

other ‚Äì the other systems to test compatibility

Returns:

True if other system is compatible with this one. False otherwise. Two systems are compatible if they do not share macsylib.hit.CoreHit except hit corresponding to a multi_system gene in the model.

Note

This method is used to compute the best combination of systems.

property loci_nb: intÔÉÅ
Returns:

The number of loci of this system (loners are not considered)

Return type:

int >= 0

property loci_num: list[int]ÔÉÅ
Returns:

the number of the corresponding locus for each cluster the cluster made of only one Loner are not considered as a loci so these clusters have a negative locus_num

property multi_loci: boolÔÉÅ
Returns:

True if the systems is encoded in multiple loci. False otherwise

occurrence() → int[source]ÔÉÅ

sometimes several systems collocates so they form only one cluster so macsylib build only one system the occurrence is an indicator of how many systems are it‚Äôs based on the number of occurrence of each mandatory genes The multi_system genes are not take in account.

Returns:

a predict number of biologic systems

property score: floatÔÉÅ
Returns:

a score take in account * if a hit match for the gene or it is an exchangeable gene * if a hit is duplicated and already present in the system or the cluster * if a hit match for mandatory/accessory gene of the model

Return type:

float

RejectedCandidateÔÉÅ

class macsylib.system.RejectedCandidate(*args, **kwargs)[source]ÔÉÅ

Handle a set of clusters which has been rejected during the macsylib.system.match() step This clusters (can be one) does not fill the requirements or contains forbidden genes.

__init__(model: Model, clusters: list[Cluster], reasons: list[str]) → None[source]ÔÉÅ
Parameters:

  • model

  • clusters ‚Äì list of clusters. These Clusters should be created with macsylib.cluster.Cluster of macsylib.hit.ModelHit objects

  • reasons ‚Äì the reason why these clusters have been rejected

a string representation of this RejectedCandidates

LikelySystemÔÉÅ

class macsylib.system.LikelySystem(*args, **kwargs)[source]ÔÉÅ

‚Äù Handle components that fill the quorum requirements defined in model. with no idea about genetic organization (gene cluster) so we cannot take in account forbidden genes

  • neutral_hits ‚Äì The list of neutral hits (encode for a gene tagged as neutral)
